text: so here's more design philosophy okay
tomorrow
is not promised so you should be writing
code that you need today
not tomorrow i cannot tell you
unfortunately
the handful of times in my life where i
walked into work
and was told they just let go of the cto
everybody stop what you're doing if your
products already in production
maintain it if not you're done until the
new cto comes in and decides
what she wants to do right now you're in
limbo for two weeks
and then they hire the new cto and now
you lose another month
and most likely if your product is not
in production
it's done it's over with and so from a
design philosophy
i'm always about the idea of let's just
write the code
we need now and let's get this into
production
every you know that term technical debt
you know what it means to me
everybody has a different meaning right
but i can tie it to design philosophy
wrenching
technical debt to me is every day a
piece of code is sitting on
your laptop and not in production that's
technical debt i am hiring you to solve
a problem
that problem is not being solved on your
desk that's all the problem is being
solved in production
so if you're not getting that code in
production what am i paying you for
